history.content:
I took a similar schedule: 160 + 162 + 189 + R1B course. It is definitely doable, but I would say that was one of my hardest semesters here. Do not underestimate 160, that class can get really overwhelming with all the projects, and if you're stuck in a bad project group for your final project, it can get especially hectic towards the end of the semester. 

186 is definitely easier than 162, and 170 and 189 are about similar in level of difficulty, so I think you could do it. But be prepared to spend a lot of time on 160.

------------------------

I am doing 186+170 and a bunch of other classes this semester (18+ units) and it's been doable and great. I would recommend Data 100 just because it sounds cool.

I took a similar schedule: 160 + 162 + 189 + R1B course. It is definitely doable, but I would say that was one of my hardest semesters here. Do not underestimate 160, that class can get really overwhelming with all the projects, and if you're stuck in a bad project group for your final project, it can get especially hectic towards the end of the semester. 

186 is definitely easier than 162, and 170 and 189 are about similar in level of difficulty, so I think you could do it. But be prepared to spend a lot of time on 160.

children.subject:
Were you extremely busy, or did it still give you some time to breathe?

For some background, I have been taking ~20 units the past semesters (i.e. Math54, EE16A, CS61C, Music20B, Korean1A in one semester). I'm just unsure now because this will be my first time taking upper divs. 

Do you also have some suggestions on how to pick upper divs? I chose 170 because it seems like a class everyone takes, then 160/100/186 based on my interest (and because I have fulfilled the 'prereq' based on HKN coursemap).

I am taking 170 + 186 + 184 + teaching + etc and I still have time to take a rest. Not sure about data100, but I expect 160 to have approximately similar workload as 184 (regular assignments during the semester, and a big final project at the end? correct me if i am wrong).

history.content:
I'm planning on taking 186 and 170 + one other cs class next semester. 

What's the workload like for just the 186 and 170 combination? For my third class, I'm thinking either 160 or data100. 

I think data100 would be more manageable than 160, but 160 works much better for my schedule, so I'm not sure which one I should go with. 

I might also take Korean10A on top of this.
